name: Oteilâ€™s Egyptian Kush
description: Oteil’s Egyptian Kush was created through a collaboration between GroundSwell's master cultivator, genetics aficionado: T-Dogg Gardens, and Oteil Burbridge, the Grammy-winning bassist from the Allman Brothers and Dead & Company. With two powerhouse indica-leaning parents, this strain boasts dense nugs and sweet cherry flavor backed up by hints of diesel and anise. Energetic and uplifting up front, Oteil’s Egyptian Kush provides a blissful body effect that grabs ahold slowly without weighing you down. This strain may be great for pain management, insomnia, happiness, and relaxation.
descriptionPlain: Oteil’s Egyptian Kush was created through a collaboration between GroundSwell's master cultivator, genetics aficionado: T-Dogg Gardens, and Oteil Burbridge, the Grammy-winning bassist from the Allman Brothers and Dead & Company. With two powerhouse indica-leaning parents, this strain boasts dense nugs and sweet cherry flavor backed up by hints of diesel and anise. Energetic and uplifting up front, Oteil’s Egyptian Kush provides a blissful body effect that grabs ahold slowly without weighing you down. This strain may be great for pain management, insomnia, happiness, and relaxation.

highlightedReviews.text: Picked this up from GroundSwell Cannabis Boutique earlier this week, and immediately fell in love. The bud itself was beautiful and dense, full of frosty trichomes and pretty orange calyxes. The flavor off the first pull was really sweet, and on exhale I tasted a pleasant little burst of diesel. I smoked a few bowls, picked up my guitar and found myself on the couch still practicing scales two hours later. The wind-down wasn't bad either, not too sleepy as I was still able to finish out the rest of the stuff I had planned for the day. Great strain!

Another fantastic Hybrid. Strong enough to ease muscle pain, and relax, but not so strong that I am unmotivated to get things done. It also increases appetite, which isn't great in my case, but can be beneficial to cancer patients, and the elderly.
